bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Barbara G. Ellis - "Writer. High school English and journalism teacher in Portland, OR, and Gorham, ME; Pacific University, Forest Grove, OR, instructor in English composition; Benedictine Heights College of Oklahoma, assistant professor of journalism and department chair; Oregon State University, Corvallis, assistant professor of technical journalism; McNeese State University, Lake Charles, LA, professor of mass communications, founder and director of McNeese Conference for Weekly and Small Daily Newspaper Staffs of Louisiana, 1992–99; Ellis and Associates (writing and editing service), Portland, principal, 1999–. News-Times, Forest Grove, assistant editor, copy editor, reporter, photographer, and darkroom manager; Daily News, Lewiston, MT, assistant editor, copy editor, reporter, photographer, and darkroom manager; Life, reporter; Daily Star, Beirut, Lebanon, chief editorial writer and editorial page director; Reporter, Portland, copy editor; International Medical Group Tabloids, associate editor; Sears, Roebuck and Co., copy writer and advertising layout person; Standard Insurance Co., Portland, director of publi-cations, also designer, writer, and editor of monthly magazine, weekly newsletter, and retirees' quarterly publication. PDX Dean Shoeleather Brigade (political canvassing team), member, 2003–04." -- https://www.encyclopedia.com/arts/educational-magazines/ellis-barbara-g - 2021.06.03

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: "The Triangle Waist Company factory occupied the 8th, 9th, and 10th floors of the 10-story Asch Building on the northwest corner of Greene Street and Washington Place, just east of Washington Square Park, in the Greenwich Village neighborhood of New York City. Under the ownership of Max Blanck and Isaac Harris, the factory produced women's blouses, known as "shirtwaists". The factory normally employed about 500 workers, mostly young Italian and Jewish immigrant women and girls, who worked nine hours a day on weekdays plus seven hours on Saturdays, earning for their 52 hours of work between $7 and $12 a week, the equivalent of $191 to $327 a week in 2018 currency, or $3.67 to $6.29 per hour." -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triangle_Shirtwaist_Factory_fire - 2021.06.03
